headline: Apple CEO Tim Cook Buys $3 Million of Nike Stock
summary: Apple  CEO Tim Cook bought nearly $3 million shares of depressed  Nike  stock following the company’s disappointing earnings report last week.  Cook, who is the lead independent director of Nike and a board member since 2005, bought 50,000 shares of Nike stock on Monday at an average price of $58.97, according to a form 4 filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission late Tuesday.  Cook now holds just over 105,000 shares of the footwear maker.

content.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook Buys $3 Million of Nike Stock
content.summary: Apple  CEO Tim Cook bought nearly $3 million shares of depressed  Nike  stock following the company’s disappointing earnings report last week.  Cook, who is the lead independent director of Nike and a board member since 2005, bought 50,000 shares of Nike stock on Monday at an average price of $58.97, according to a form 4 filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission late Tuesday.  Cook now holds just over 105,000 shares of the footwear maker.

headline: Nike stock up 2% in pre-market after Apple CEO buys shares
summary: Investing.com -- Nike Inc. (NYSE:NKE) shares rose over 2% in pre-market trading on Wednesday following a regulatory filing showing that Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) CEO and Nike board member Tim Cook purchased 50,000 shares of Nike Class B stock. The shares were bought at an average price of $58.97 per share, totaling roughly $2.9 million.

content.title: Nike stock up 2% in pre-market after Apple CEO buys shares
content.summary: Investing.com -- Nike Inc. (NYSE:NKE) shares rose over 2% in pre-market trading on Wednesday following a regulatory filing showing that Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) CEO and Nike board member Tim Cook purchased 50,000 shares of Nike Class B stock. The shares were bought at an average price of $58.97 per share, totaling roughly $2.9 million.

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Nike, UiPath, Tesla, AMC, Strategy, and More
summary: Stock futures were a touch lower on Wednesday, as investors waited to see if a Santa Claus rally would lift markets over the final few trading sessions of 2025.  Nike  climbed 2.2% to $58.57 in premarket trading.  Cook snapped up the stock following Nike’s second-quarter earnings report last week, which disappointed investors due to declining profits and lackluster sales in China.

headline: S&P 500 record, commodities, Apple CEO buys Nike shares: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) hover around their flatline after the S&P 500 (^GSPC) closed at a record high on Tuesday. In the commodity trade, precious metals gold (GC=F), silver (SI=F), platinum (PL=F), and copper (HG=F) have reached new all-time highs; oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) is on track to see weekly gains after recent declines. Apple (AAPL) CEO Tim Cook reportedly bought almost $3 million in Nike (NKE) shares. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

Apple (AAPL) CEO Tim Cook reportedly bought almost $3 million in Nike (NKE) shares.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Intel, Nike, UiPath, Tesla, AMC, Strategy, Dynavax, and More
summary: Stock futures were a touch lower on Wednesday, as investors waited to see if a Santa Claus rally would lift markets over the final few trading sessions of 2025.  Intel   fell 2.5% in premarket trading after Reuters reported that  Nvidia  had tested whether to manufacture chips using Intel’s production process but stopped moving forward with the plans.  Nvidia  and Intel didn’t immediately respond to Barron’s requests for comment.

headline: Intel shares slide after report Nvidia halts testing of 18A process
summary: Investing.com -- Intel Corporation stock dropped 2% Wednesday after Reuters reported that Nvidia stopped testing Intel’s 18A chip manufacturing process. The stock opened as much as 3.9% lower before erasing some losses.

content.title: Intel shares slide after report Nvidia halts testing of 18A process
content.summary: Investing.com -- Intel Corporation stock dropped 2% Wednesday after Reuters reported that Nvidia stopped testing Intel’s 18A chip manufacturing process. The stock opened as much as 3.9% lower before erasing some losses.

headline: 3 Market-Beating Stocks on Our Watchlist
summary: The best-performing stocks typically have robust sales growth, increasing margins, and rising returns on capital, and those that can maintain this trifecta year in and year out often become the legends of the investing world.

content.title: 3 Market-Beating Stocks on Our Watchlist
